poem:
"Revisiting Bonds"

Past Bond, in shadow of '69,
Endorses new favorite for the line.
Can handle stunts, love in a tux,
Ladies yearn for such paradox.
Though offer has not been proffered,
The screen anticipates its offer. 
The wheel turns, Bond remains,
In different guise, yet same refrains.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "George Lazenby backs Aaron Taylor-Johnson for Bond George Lazenby, who played 007 in 1969’s On Her Majesty’s Secret Service, has endorsed the current frontrunner Aaron Taylor-Johnson to take over as the next James Bond. Speaking to TMZ, Lazenby said he believed Taylor-Johnson, “can handle the stunts, and all the ladies who love a man in a tux”. The Australian actor added that he understood that Taylor-Johnson had not yet been formally offered the role, given". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

The Australian actor added that he understood that Taylor-Johnson had not yet been formally offered the role, given
